content.1: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.
content.2: Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound
content.3: He directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning unto the ends of the earth.
content.4: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.
content.5: God thundereth marvellously with his voice; great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.
content.6: For he saith to the snow, Be thou
content.7: He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.
content.8: Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.
content.9: Out of the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.
content.10: By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.
content.11: Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:
content.12: And it is turned round about by his counsels: that they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the world in the earth.
content.13: He causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.
content.14: Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
content.15: Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?
content.16: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge?
content.18: Hast thou with him spread out the sky,
content.19: Teach us what we shall say unto him;
content.20: Shall it be told him that I speak? if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.
